intro: Ceanothus capensis, commonly known as the Cape heath or bluebells, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, leathery leaves and blooms in spring with bright blue or violet flowers. Ceanothus capensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal climates.
